alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 09 at 6:11PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM MST/815 PM MDT/ THIS EVENING FROM AREAS NEAR WUPATKI NATIONAL MONUMENT TO GRAY MOUNTAIN... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of north central Arizona, including the following county, Coconino. * WHEN...Until 715 PM MST /815 PM MDT/. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 609 PM MST /709 PM MDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain has ended with light rainfall continuing at this time. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly due to runoff from previous heavy rain. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Tohachi Wash, Jackrabbit Wash, Deadman Wash, Cedar Wash, Citadel Wash, Haada Is Taani Di Wash, Kish Zhini Wash, Badger Wash, Kanaa Wash, Mays Wash, Tse To Baah Naali Wash, Little Mexican Spring Wash, Doney Mountain Wash, Antelope Wash, Tonahakaad Spring, Hulls Wash, Paiute Trail Wash, Landmark Wash, Sei Haasgaii Wash, Little Colorado River, White Water Wash, Campbell Francis Wash and Ball Court Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wupatki National Monument, Nalahiku Pueblo, Doney Mountain, Wukoki Pueblo, Gray Mountain, and Black Falls. - This includes U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 440 and 459. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
